Changes in temperatures and precipitation will also affect the species phenology in ways we do not clearly understand. There is little information about the specific cues that trigger flowering in agaves, but there is consensus that precipitation is an important variable
23, 42 . We recommend implementing an annual monitoring program in the study area to document flowering timing in the agave populations and associated precipitation data. This information will help to elucidate long-term trends in the Agave-L. nivalis interaction that will result from changing patterns in precipitation and inform future modelling exercises.
